page.title: 03INDUSTRY in THUNDRIDGE cont.
page.content: to continue with the order. The firm's annual sales are around one million pounds. Control panels have been designed and made for many industries including the British Steel Corporation, water authorities, oil companies and breweries. One order that was nearly completed was to operate the freezers at a Sainsbury's new store. The company likes to take on school leavers of sixteen and train them by sending them on day release to college. Some trainees are on the YTS scheme. The salaries offered are good. The business is expanding and at the moment there are 30 employees: ten working in the drawing office and twenty in the workshop.Each person is assigned to order and sees it through. Competition is fierce but the company has a name for producing quality goods at competitive prices.
